TER.TERcoder.SegmentCoder
Class EncodeGaggleAC

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERcoder.SegmentCoder.EncodeGaggleAC

public class EncodeGaggleAC
extends java.lang.Object

This class entropy encodes the bitstream generated by the bit plane encoder requires. Usage example:
  construct
  setParameters
  run

Version:
1.1
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

Field Detail

encodedGaggle

BitStream[] encodedGaggle
This bitstream is used to store the sorting of a coded gaggle for a given bitplane after the entropy encoder. encodedGaggle[resolutionLevel]

sortingACGaggle

ByteStream[][][][] sortingACGaggle
This bitstream contains the coded gaggle after the bit plane encoder, it also contains the contexts preceding the encoded words if necessary sortingACGaggle[block][resolutionLevel][subband][codingPass]

entropyAC

int entropyAC
This array indicated the type of entropy encoder. Valid values are:
  • 0 - No entropy code for AC components
  • 1 - CCSDS Recommended entropy coder

resolutionLevels

int resolutionLevels
Definition in SegmentCode2D.resolutionLevels

parametersSet

boolean parametersSet
To know if parameters are set.

True indicates that they are set otherwise false.

ids

int[] ids
Indicates whether idSelection has been initialized.

codeLength

int[] codeLength
Definition in CodeBlockAC.codeLength

idSelection

int[] idSelection
Indicates for each length (2,3 or 4) the entropy code option that has been chosen.

noCodeId

int[] noCodeId
Determines the ID for no code option for 2, 3 and 4 length symbols.

codeIdLength

int[] codeIdLength
Determines the number of bits required to encode the code option ID for 2, 3 and 4 length symbols.

setParameters

public void setParameters(ByteStream[][][][] sortingACGaggle,
                          int entropyAC,
                          int[] codeLength,
                          int resolutionLevels)
Set the parameters used to entropy encode a gaggle.

Parameters:
sortingACGaggle - definition in sortingACGaggle
entropyAC - definition in entropyAC
codeLength - definition in CodeBlockAC.codeLength
resolutionLevels - definition in resolutionLevels

run

public BitStream[] run()
                throws java.lang.Exception
Performs entropy coding.

Returns:
an array of bitstreams containing the entropy encoded image
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and entropy encoding must be stopped

recommendedACEncoding

private void recommendedACEncoding()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Entropy encode the bit stream generated by the bit plane encoder according to the specifications of the recommendation for image data coding provided by the CCSDS.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and entropy encoding must be stopped

putResolutionLevel

private void putResolutionLevel(int block,
                                int rLevel)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
This function entropy encodes (according to CCSDS-IDC recommendation) the bit stream corresponding to the resolution level of a single block.

Parameters:
block - indicates the number of the block inside the gaggle
rLevel - indicates the resolution level to be entropy encoded
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and entropy encoding must be stopped

putSymbol

private void putSymbol(int symbol,
                       int length,
                       int rLevel)
This function adds a symbol to the resulting entropy encoded bit stream

Parameters:
symbol - indicates the symbol to be added
length - indicates the length of the symbol
rLevel - indicates the resolution level where the symbol belongs

setIdSelection

private void setIdSelection()
Sets the code option for the 2, 3 and 4 length symbols. The selection is based in the data contained in CodeBlockAC.codeLength.

mapIntoSymbol

private int mapIntoSymbol(int word,
                          byte context)
Determines the symbol that corresponds to the word and the context given

Parameters:
word - contains a word that has been encoded
context - indicates the kind of word to be encoded, i.e. the lenght and the encoding pass
Returns:
the symbol that correspond to the given word with the given context

getLength

private int getLength(byte context)
Determines the lenght of a word from its context.

Parameters:
context - indicates the kind of word to be encoded, i.e. the lenght and the encoding pass
Returns:
the length of the encoded word, for sign word the length is expressed with a negative number

rawACEncoding

private void rawACEncoding()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Raw encode the bit stream generated by the bit plane encoder

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and entropy encoding must be stopped

                                   int rLevel)
